title: IELTS - TECHNOLOGY Makes Our Life BETTER?

json.text:
Hello. Welcome to IELTS KILLER
The video series which gives you with the

best ideas to use in your important IELTS
Writing Essay.
Let’s look at today’s topic

It is said that the fast pace of our everyday
life,

as a direct result of the rapid development
of telecommunications technology & travel

industry,
has negative effects on individuals, nations

& the globe.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?

Look at the keywords here: telecommunications
technology –

travel industry –
negative –

individuals –
nations & the globe.

In this essay, you must point out
that if you agree telecommunications technology

& travel industry
have negatively impacted those 3 aspects.

And again, like usual,
You have to make your essay impressive by
stating the problems alongside with the benefits.

Let's see the positive side
With the incredible development in telecommunications,

people can make inquiries by phone, instead
of traveling long distances.

Internet access makes it possible for one
to perform various tasks without leaving their
offices.

Even if people have to travel every now & then
for meeting business partners,

clients & relatives in other cities or other
purposes,

modern transport networks reduce the amount
of time they spend on commutes.

Also, thanks to this technological advances,
social relationships are no longer restricted

by physical factors
such as geographical distance & low mobility

However, on the negative side, 
this fast-paced lifestyle is responsible

for the considerable increase in lifestyle-related
problems.

Jobs now become more demanding & require workers'
full commitment , leading to their depression

& pressure.
Besides, the employees actually have to work

longer than they're supposed to do,
primarily because fax, e-mail & other communication

devices
have made them accessible to their supervisors,

colleagues & customers after work.
They have to respond instantly

to voice & email messages from others. Otherwise,
they'll be considered rude, unhelpful & disrespectful

.
Private life has to be sacrificed, unfortunately.

In general, many aspects of people's daily
lives have undergone major changes

b/c of the recent development in technology.
While we enjoy greater well-being,

which is reflected in close contact with the
ones we love and less travel-related stress,
we might have to accept frequent intrusions
as well as demanding, stressful jobs.
